audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a welcoming tone, spoken by a female speaker, addressing the audience with "what's up you guys welcome back to the channel". The speaker mentions a video about reducing lag in The Sims 4 and then transitions to discussing ReShade, a program they cannot live without because it makes the game appear more vibrant with a pop of color.

The audio clip begins with a single speaker, a female, who explains what reshade is, describing it as an "external" plugin to enhance game visuals and brightness, and mentioning the availability of presets from creators in the Sims community. She expresses admiration for presets found on Tumblr, speaking in a casual and enthusiastic tone.

The clip starts with a woman explaining ReShade, stating they are going to "download it." She directs listeners to a website with a purple "download" button. Then she explains that the current version is "ReShade 4.9.1".

The audio clip starts with a female speaker giving instructions. She starts calmly, then mentions specifics like "reshade setup," "browse," "this PC," "windows C," "program files 86," "origin games," "the Sims 4," "game," "bin," and "the Sims 4 64 bit". She appears to be helping someone navigate software.

A female speaker explains to the listener to be mindful which option to select. They advise to always click on the option that says "64" after it. With a conversational tone, she continues giving instructions for installing the shaders. She states "select the first one, which is Direct 3D9", explains that she has already installed it, and states she's going to do "update." She mentions that they're going to see a list of shaders. She says it's up to them if they want to install any of these. She says that she prefers more simple reshades that don't have a lot of shaders, and some reshades do require some. She instructs the listener to hit "Okay," then says the reshade setup was successful and that the reshade will be in your game.

The audio clip begins with a speaker who appears to be female sharing her experiences at Max's Match CC World. She sounds enthusiastic, saying "If you don't know what that is, you're living under a rock," and praises it as "the best place for CC". She transitions to discussing a website she will link below for ReShade presets, highlighting the large number of available options. She notes that "a lot of these require... some more shaders" and might not function well on a "low-end PC."

The audio clip begins with a female speaker suggesting to "take a look," but recommending "Ocean Sims" or "Urban Sims" as alternatives. She explains these are the only two she knows that don't "break your game". She currently uses "Ocean Sims' preset", after "tweaking it" for vibrancy. She promises to list both Sims options below. She urges the listener to decide for themself. The audio clip ends.

The clip begins with speech. A female speaker is explaining that after downloading a preset, it will appear with a gear icon. She then copies the preset, and proceeds to explain the steps for inserting the preset into a game file, saying you have to go to "this PC," and so on. If properly installed, "reshade shaders should be here." She explains how to move the preset "into the bin file" so it will be accessible in the game. The speaker's tone is instructive and clear.

The clip begins with a female speaker instructing the listener to look for a grey bar at the top of the screen to confirm the installation of "reshade", prompting them to press the "home" key. Upon doing so, a welcome message will appear. She then mentions skipping the tutorial due to not wanting to deal with the "fancy stuff." She advises others to do the same before directing the listener to find a ".ini" file that they have downloaded, namely the "preset" file, demonstrated by her clicking on "Ocean Sims Simple Sim." The speech then concludes with the speaker instructing the listener to select the file, which will add it to their game.

The audio clip begins with a female speaker explaining how her ReShade looks in-game, noting that it's a little more vibrant than Ocean Sims' version, and how she loves it. The speaker then describes how to press the Home button to go to Settings and choose a key on the keyboard that will toggle the ReShade effects. She chooses the End key, noting she forgot that the End key was like "going up and down". The speaker states the game is "fine", "okay", but "super dull" without ReShade; but then with ReShade it is "super bright", "super crazy colorful". She ends with saying, "I just love it. I love ReShade." There is quiet background music throughout the clip.

The clip starts with a single speaker, a woman, in a casual, informative tone, discussing how to revert reshade settings. She mentions going back to "home" and finding "different effects" to "mess with", emphasizing user preference in customizing visuals, from "super vibrant and colorful" to a "chill, laidback side".

The clip starts with a single female speaker concluding her tutorial on reshade installation, expressing hope that it was helpful and encouraging viewers to like and subscribe. Her tone is friendly and instructional. The speaker then says goodbye and the audio fades out.
